{"step_by_step_thinking": "In denture construction, resin is packed into the mold in different stages. The 'sandy stage' refers to the stage where the impression material is still wet and loose. If resin is packed in this stage, it will be trapped between the impression material and the mold. When the denture is processed, this trapped resin will not be able to escape and will remain within the denture. This can lead to a number of issues, including... ", "answer_choice": "B"}
